title: 111_hr3901
content: The "Homebuyer Tax Credit Improvement Act of 2009" enhances the administration of the first-time homebuyer tax credit. The "Homebuyer Tax Credit Improvement Act of 2009" amends the age limitation for the tax credit, requiring taxpayers to be at least 18 years old at the time of purchasing a residence. Additionally, documentation requirements are updated under this act. The "Homebuyer Tax Credit Improvement Act of 2009" updates documentation requirements for the first-time homebuyer tax credit, including penalties for failing to attach a settlement statement to the tax return and restrictions on married individuals acquiring a residence from the family of their spouse. Additionally, errors related to claiming the tax credit are treated as mathematical or clerical errors. The amendments to the first-time homebuyer tax credit include new documentation requirements and penalties for non-compliance. The effective date for these changes varies depending on the specific amendment. SEC. 3. CERTAIN TAX RETURN PREPARERS REQUIRED TO FILE RETURNS ELECTRONICALLY. SEC. 3 amends subsection (e) of section 6011 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to require tax return preparers to file individual income tax returns on magnetic media if they are specified tax return preparers for the calendar year, unless they expect to file 100 or fewer returns. The amendment defines "individual income tax return" and makes a conforming amendment to section 6011(e) of the Internal Revenue Code. The effective date for these changes is for returns filed after December 31, 2010.
